title: Weak effects of prebiotically plausible peptides on self-triphosphorylation ribozyme function
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00129J, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Joshua T. Arriola, Shayan Poordian, Estefanía Martínez Valdivia, Tommy Le, Luke J. Leman, Joan G. Schellinger, Ulrich F. Müller
From a library of 1014 RNA sequences, the strongest benefit of a prebiotically plausible peptide was by peptide 4 (arrow) on ribozyme S2. The names 1–10 of ten tested peptides are indicated, together with their overall charges (0, −, +).
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
